titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Blacksburg Post Office Record Books, 1914-1922
titlestmt.subtitle: Blacksburg Post Office Record Books Ms1973-009

titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms1973-009

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection consists of five record books taken from the Blacksburg Post Office, dating July, 1914 to April 25, 1922

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Blacksburg Post Office Record Books must be obtained by Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Blacksburg Post Office Record Books, 1914-22, Ms73-009, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Blacksburg Post Office Record Books were donated to Newman Library in November 1973.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Blacksburg Post Office Record Books was completed in 2004.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Blacksburg Post Office was initially established as "Blacksburgh" on April 9, 1827, changing its name to Blacksburg on April 15, 1893. The post office had many locations around Blacksburg, including the corner of South Main and East Washington Street, the Lancaster house on the west side of Main Street, and for many years located on College Avenue, before the current location on Main Street was constructed in 1935.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of five record books taken from the Blacksburg Post Office, dating July, 1914 to April 25, 1922. One volume consists of the Postmaster's Account and Record Book, and the other four volumes are cash books of the International Money Order Office, without individual names.

did.unittitle: Cash Books of the International Money Order Office
